channel.title: CoolIT SYSTEMS ECO-R Water Cooler or CORSAIR Cooling Hydro Series Water Cooler
channel.description:
I first spotted the CoolIt SYSTEMS ECO-R Cooler on the AMD promotion page for their Phenom II. I don't want to take any chances with my processor overheating and good cooling is key for increasing processor longevity.
http://promotions.newegg.com/AMD/6core/index.html?cm_sp=brand_AMD-_-AMD6core-_- http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835227006
The corsair brand seems to be reliable though.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835181010

item.title: CoolIT SYSTEMS ECO-R Water Cooler or CORSAIR Cooling Hydro Series Water Cooler
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Also, I just got it installed but it doesn’t get past 45C with full prime test, this is with the fact that I think I have the fan installed the wrong direction so I have to take that off in a minute.

item.title: CoolIT SYSTEMS ECO-R Water Cooler or CORSAIR Cooling Hydro Series Water Cooler
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Get the Corsair H50, both me and Thug-life have one and I haven’t had any problems yet. (Just for reference, my Q6600 won’t go past 40c).
